text: Being able to add custom classes would be awesome too. So you can just add classes to keep it in keeping with the theme, I used to do this in wordpress. e.g. if the design uses a colour for emphasis you can select the class rather than trying to pick the right colour from a colour picker

Idea: In workflows add ability for annotations/comments/descriptions to describe what’s happening at each stage to make it easier for someone new to understand why it’s set up as it is.
In my case I’ve created some webhooks, And when someone sees a webhook they have no idea other than reading a URL to know whats happening.
:wave:  For the specific case of webhooks, have you seen Workflow Extensions? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflow-extensions/workflow-extensions-overview>
